The Hospital Corporation of America is offering $200 million of 8 1/2 percent, 30-year sinking-fund debentures at 97.36 to yield 8.75 percent, with underwriters led by Salomon Brothers.
Rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.&P., the issue yields about 1.15 percentage points more than 30-year Treasury bonds.

Sinking-fund payments beginning in 1998 will retire 5 percent of the issue annually but may be increased at the company's option. Depending on the size of these payments, the debentures' average life will range from 20.5 years to 13.9 years.
